meanings.definition: An area of high or hilly land.
meanings.sent1: The cows grazed peacefully on the upland.
meanings.sent2: The village was nestled in the upland, overlooking the valley below.
meanings.sent3: The children loved rolling down the upland, giggling all the way.
meanings.sent4: Her spirit soared like an eagle over the upland of her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The upland stood tall and proud, a crown on the landscape.

meanings.definition: Land that is elevated above the surrounding area.
meanings.sent1: The castle was built on the upland to overlook the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The upland provided a clear view of the entire valley.
meanings.sent3: The upland seemed to play hide and seek with the clouds above.
meanings.sent4: His ambitions reached the upland of success he had always dreamed of.
meanings.sent5: The upland was like a pedestal, lifting everything above the ordinary.

meanings.sent1: The upland was covered in a blanket of wildflowers.
meanings.sent2: Hiking up the upland was a challenging but rewarding experience.
meanings.sent3: The upland was like a giant staircase leading to the sky.
meanings.sent4: The upland was a fortress of nature, standing strong against time.
meanings.sent5: The upland whispered secrets of ancient times to those who listened.
